description.narrative: By 2016, the net enrollment rate is increased from 66% to 80% in seven post conflict prefectures., which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, 80% of school aged children, especially girls and the most vulnerable, benefit from access to basic education.

participating-org.narrative: AGENCE D AIDE A LA COOPERATION TECH ET AU DEVELOPPEMENT ACTED
PRSEC STP EDUCATION NATIONALE MINISTERE EDUCATION NATIONALE

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
System strengthening - community participation and social accountability, e.g. school management committees

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, the net enrollment rate is increased from 66% to 80% in seven post conflict prefectures.

description.narrative: Access to pre and primary school has improved, thanks to efforts undertaken by the Government supported by UNICEF and partners to build and equip schools, distribute teaching and learning materials to target schools throughout CAR. Measuring progress towards this output remains a challenge due to limited up to date data | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/01/2018

title.narrative: Net enrolment rate in primary education, both sexes

actual.value: 2015:No data available: School statistical yearbook was not finalized , may be available at the end of 2016

title.narrative: School-aged children and adolescents in affected areas back in school (including early childhood education programmes) after interruption or newly enrolled since the emergency - number & percent
